text.sentence: Retail | U.S. Retail Hardlines eleven May two thousand fifteen
Raising threeQ Comp to three percent ; Corporate Initiatives Ahead of Plan; Reiterate OW
We are increasing our comp expectation for AutoZone's fiscal threeQ from two percent to three percent, based on accelerating trends in the latter part of the company's quarter.
After a slow start, where we believe comps were negative due solely to the timing of tax rebates, we believe sales accelerated, particularly in failure related categories in most markets.
Our three percent comp expectation is especially noteworthy, given our estimate incorporates a fifty one hundred bp impact from the timing of tax benefits out of FthreeQ and into FtwoQ.
Additionally, we believe AutoZone is ahead of plan with respect to accelerating its commitment to serving the DIFM customer.
After announcing last quarter plans to open three additional mega hubs by fiscal year end, we believe all three mega hubs are now open, increasing the company's commitment to serving the Pro.
Recall a typical mega hub is twenty five thirtyk square feet, and has eighty one hundredk SKUs, effectively increasing part availability at the company.
Each mega hub can service five ten hubs, which in turn can support ten fifty stores.
In total, we believe the five mega hubs today can support an estimated thirty five forty percent of AutoZone's domestic store base.
Together with an increase in delivery frequency, which AutoZone continues to test at four hundred fifty five hundred stores today, the commercial customer remains a key focus for AutoZone.
Furthermore, we believe that the prior plan to open two or three DCs over the next few years will likely ultimately result in three, with the first opening in twoHsixteen.
Additionally, with a greater concentration of full time employees vs. its competitors, we believe AutoZone remains well positioned to increase share in the fast growing DIFM market.

We believe the strong company specific initiatives together with strong industry data, including the percent y/y decline in gas and miles driven data, among the best in twelve years should likely continue to drive momentum at the company.

U.S. Retail Hardlines Industry View: NEUTRAL Stock Rating: OVERWEIGHT two thousand fourteenA nine thousand four hundred seventy five two thousand eighty one one thousand eight hundred thirty one thousand six hundred sixty three one thousand seventy thirty one.fifty

two thousand fifteenE ten thousand ninety one two thousand two hundred eighty one two thousand fifteen one thousand eight hundred twenty five one thousand one hundred fifty nine thirty six.twenty thirty two. .

two thousand sixteenE ten thousand five hundred ninety six two thousand four hundred fourteen two thousand one hundred thirty one one thousand nine hundred sixteen one thousand two hundred seventeen forty one.twenty

two thousand seventeenE eleven thousand one hundred twenty six two thousand five hundred sixty five two thousand two hundred sixty five two thousand fifty one thousand three hundred two forty six.fifty twenty eight. .
AutoZone offers consistent earnings growth and a commitment to enhancing shareholder value.
Our price target uses a multiple of twenty twox our two thousand fifteen fiscal year EPS estimate.
Our upside scenario uses a multiple of twenty threex our two thousand fifteen fiscal year EPS estimate.
Downside risks include material increases in gasoline prices, a change in the competitive landscape and pricing pressure.
Our downside scenario uses a multiple of fifteenx our two thousand fifteen fiscal year EPS estimate.

Income statement Revenue EBITDA EBIT Pre tax income Net income EPS Diluted shares DPS Margin and return data EBITDA margin EBIT margin Pre tax margin Net margin ROIC ROA ROE Balance sheet and cash flow Cash and equivalents Total assets Short and long term debt Other long term liabilities Total liabilities Net debt/ Shareholders' equity Change in working capital Cash flow from operations Capital expenditure Free cash flow Valuation and leverage metrics P/E EV/EBITDA FCF yield P/Sales P/BV Dividend yield Total debt/capital Selected operating metrics Sales growth Same store sales growth Number of stores Square footage growth Inventory growth
We are confident in AutoZone's strength as an executor within a strong industry.
This should support long term company specific outperformance and provide AutoZone with a long tail of comp growth.

Recall that, last month, we hosted a series of meetings with AutoZone CEO Bill Rhodes, who highlighted several of the company's ongoing initiatives, including one) investments in distribution, including AutoZone's mega hub initiatives, new distribution centers and a focus on greater delivery frequency, two) the LT potential of the company's commercial business, three) the opportunities to leverage IMC, and four) the company's insulation from e commerce.
We remain confident that AutoZone will open at least three hundred commercial programs during fiscal two thousand fifteen.

We view AutoZone's investments in mega hubs and commercial desks ­ ongoing initiatives that Mister Rhodes emphasized throughout our meetings ­ as particularly meaningful, both for near term and longer term performance: · Mega hubs: After announcing last quarter plans to open three additional mega hubs by fiscal year end, we believe all three Mega hubs are now open, increasing the company's commitment to serving the Pro.
Recall a typical mega hub is twenty five thirtyk square feet, and has eighty one hundredk SKUs, effectively increasing part availability at the company.
Each mega hub can service five ten hubs, which in turn can support ten fifty stores.
In total, we believe the five mega hubs today can support an estimated thirty five forty percent of AutoZone's domestic store base.
Commercial desks: AutoZone continues to invest in its commercial desk program, with plans to open three hundred desks in fiscal two thousand fifteen vs. four hundred last year.
With commercial desks in seventy eight percent of the company's stores today, we are not surprised that the absolute pace of commercial desk openings is slowing.
However, we expect AutoZone to continue to benefit from incremental improvements in productivity at its existing commercial desks.
We believe that commercial desk penetration could reach ninety ninety five percent long term, representing a long tailed growth opportunity for AutoZone and its commercial operations.
As an aside, thirty percent of commercial desks at AutoZone are under three years old.
Additionally, recall that, in fiscal twoQ, management noted that commercial desks five years or older comped in the mid single digit range.
Share Gains Also Likely to be a Meaningful Company Specific Driver
We also believe that AutoZone, with its relatively high degree of DIY penetration, is well positioned to capture share as Advance Auto Parts focuses on building its commercial business.
We expect this to be a tailwind both for threeQ and longer term.
Both AutoZone and O'Reilly management have indicated their view that Advance's integration of General Parts is progressing slowly.
At our April meeting with AutoZone CEO Bill Rhodes, he indicated that the integration is progressing slowly from his vantage point, with little completed on the integration itself.

He also noted that there are few Carquest conversions that have taken place to date, signaling that Advance may be missing key milestones that other peers did not when they were undertaking large acquisitions.
Additionally, on O'Reilly's oneQ earnings call, CEO Greg Henslee noted that there are some markets they really haven't done much consolidation work yet.

Additionally, we expect near term results to reflect continued industry momentum, including: one) Recent strength in miles driven data ­ with strong results in February at +two.eight percent, January at +four.nine percent, and December at +five.
percent ; two) Support from low gas prices, which are down

Barclays | AutoZone Inc. percent y/y at dollar two.sixty two/gallon; three) Continued support from long term macro data trends, including average vehicle age of +eleven years and continued increases in part ASPs.

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Below is the list of companies that constitute the industry coverage universe: U.S. Retail Hardlines ACCO Brands Corp. Barnes and Noble, Inc. Dick's Sporting Goods Inc. Mattress Firm Holding Corp. Pier one Imports Inc.
The Container Store Group Tractor Supply Co. Distribution of Ratings: Barclays Equity Research has two thousand six hundred seventy one companies under coverage.

Guide to the Barclays Research Price Target: Each analyst has a single price target on the stocks that they cover.
The price target represents that analyst's expectation of where the stock will trade in the next twelve months.
Upside/downside scenarios, where provided, represent potential upside/potential downside to each analyst's price target over the same twelve month period.
Top Picks: Barclays Equity Research's Top Picks represent the single best alpha generating investment idea within each industry, taken from among the Overweight rated stocks within that industry.
Barclays Equity Research publishes global and regional Top Picks reports every quarter and analysts may also publish intra quarter changes to their Top Picks, as necessary.
